intro: Oreoselinum podolicum, commonly known as the Podolic mountain celery, is a herbaceous plant native to the Carpathian region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in umbels. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
